Package danogl.gui.rendering

Class TextRenderable

java.lang.Object
danogl.gui.rendering.TextRenderable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
public class TextRenderable extends Object implements Renderable
A simple class for rendering strings
Author:
Dan Nirel

    • setString

      public void setString(String str, TextRenderable.MultilineHandling multilineHandling, int gapBetweenLinesInPixels)
      Set the rendered string.
      Parameters:
      str - the new string
      multilineHandling - How to handle string with multiple lines in regard to expected size
      gapBetweenLinesInPixels - How many pixels should separate different lines

    • render

      public void render(Graphics2D g, Vector2 topLeftCorner, Vector2 dimensions, double degreesCounterClockwise, boolean isFlippedHorizontally, boolean isFlippedVertically, double opaqueness)
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      Renders the object. Should be called at the render phase.
      Specified by:
      render in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object.
      topLeftCorner - Top-left corner of where to render the renderable.
      dimensions - Dimensions of the renderable (in pixels).
      degreesCounterClockwise - Angle of the image. The image is rotated around its center.
      isFlippedHorizontally - True to mirror the renderable (left-right).
      isFlippedVertically - True to mirror the renderable (up-down).
      opaqueness - 1 for opaque, 0 for invisible, values in between for degrees of transparency.
